item.title: How to Fix Controller Not Working in Wuthering Waves
item.description:
Upon release, Wuthering Waves became quite popular. Despite its apparent similarity with HoYoverse titles, it offers many new features and some errors as well. One of the most noticeable problems is using the Controllers. Therefore, this guide will tell you how to fix the Controller not working in Wuthering Waves .

Wuthering Waves has a reasonably dynamic combat system reminiscent of hack-and-slash games like Bayonetta. Therefore, it is unsurprising that many players will want to use Controllers. However, many of them face the fact that their Controllers do not work in the game.

Related
Wuthering Waves: All Ascension Materials Location

It's essential for Resonators to collect ascension materials if they want to level up their characters in Wuthering Waves.

Does Wuthering Waves Support a Controller?

Luckily, Wuthering Waves has had controller support since its release. Although this only applies to the PC version, the list of supported devices is vast. It includes PS4, PS5, and Xbox Controllers. You only need to connect your device to your PC and launch Wuthering Waves . Unfortunately, sometimes this doesn't work as it should, as many players report that they can't use their Controllers. This mainly applies to PlayStation devices.

Related
Wuthering Waves: How to Pass Time

In Wuthering Waves, sometimes you need to be in the right place and, more importantly, at the right time. So here's how to pass the time.

Wuthering Waves: How to Fix Controller Not Working

The reasons preventing players from enjoying the game with Controllers are still being determined. However, there is a way to fix the Controller not working error in Wuthering Waves , namely, using third-party applications .

More precisely, players must configure their devices so that the game recognizes their PlayStation device as a Xinput Controller. There are many different applications for this, but one of the most popular is DS4. Therefore, we will use it as an example to show how to eliminate the error.

First, of course, you need to download DS4, which you can do for free from the official website . Then, unzip the archive and install the application on your PC. After this, we recommend that you restart it.

Once you've done this, you must launch your DS4 to enjoy Wuthering Waves with your PlayStation Controller. But it's worth noting that DS4 may not find your device in rare cases. Luckily, this can be fixed relatively quickly.

To accomplish this, open DS4 and find the Device Options tab. There, you will find a list of different Controllers . Next to each one, players need to check the box and restart the app. After this, DS4 will work as it should.

item.title: Dying Light: Best Shotguns, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Hunting Shotgun offers balance of damage and versatility, ideal for mid-tier players in early to mid-game situations. Blueprints enhance customization.
  • The Double-Barrel Shotgun delivers high risk, high reward gameplay with powerful shells but limited ammo and slow reload time. Best for precise shots.
  • The Semi-Automatic Shotgun provides good balance of damage, fire rate, and magazine capacity. Fast follow-up shots and modding potential for customization.

With the infected roaming the streets of Harran, Dying Light throws players into a brutal fight for survival. Picking the right weapon can mean the difference between a desperate fight for life or a gruesome, fatal zombie attack. Whether players are seasoned slayers or new survivors navigating the ravaged city of Harran, this breakdown will equip t hem with the knowledge to choose the perfect shotgun for their playstyle and dominate the fight for survival.

Related
Dying Light: 7 Best Rifles, Ranked

When you want to go loud, you'd best be packing heat.

Dying Light offers players a variety of weapons, each with their own advantages over the dead. From frying pans to shotguns with close-quarter stopping power, it's up to the player to choose which they need strapped at their side. Deciding which shotgun reigns supreme can be a challenge, so we're sifting through the arsenal, separating the pump-action shotguns from the semi-autos, to crown the king (or queen) of close-quarters zombie-slaying.

4 Hunting Shotgun

Close-Quarters To Crowd Control, Hunt Them All

  • Firepower 911, Accuracy 25, Rate of Fire 9
  • Valued at $16,319
  • Found in stores, military vans, and the trunks of police vehicles

Dying Light holds itself as one of the top horror games of its genre. There's lots of looting, brawling, parkouring and, of course, hunting zombies. The Hunting Shotgun dealsa decent amount of damage as a base shotgun, but offers a highly-sought after gold variant that deals a huge amount of damage per shot. Players will find themselves searching for this shotgun to no avail, as it's mainly found in shops, but can occasionally be found in the back of a military van or police vehicle.

For new players, the Hunting Shotgun is a reliable mid-tier weapon that offers a good balance of damage and versatility, especially in the early to mid-game. Against tougher enemies or large hordes, players might need multiple well-placed shots. While firearm blueprints don't change damage ratings, they can change accuracy, rate of fire, magazine capacity, and add effects to bullets. Blueprints offer a variety of options, allowing players to tailor their shotgun to their specific play style, easily making this shotgun a dream shotgun under the right circumstances.

3 Double-Barrel Shotgun

Double The Trouble, Double The Fun

  • Firepower 495 to 2550, Accuracy 25, Rate of Fire 30
  • Valued at $14,044
  • Rare for beginners, but becomes more readily available in shops and around the map mid-game

The Double-Barrel Shotgun packs a serious punch with its two powerful shells, but the limited ammo and slow reload make it a high-risk, high-reward choice. This weapon is a favorite among players who crave gritty, realistic gameplay and want to feel the real effects of the zombie apocalypse.

Related
Dambuster Studios Has Good News for Dead Island 2 Fans

To celebrate a year since its launch, Dambuster Studios has some exciting news for fans of Dead Island 2 regarding what to expect.

With two shells loaded at once, it packs a serious punch, capable of taking down the scariest of zombies (yes, even Volatiles) in a single, well-aimed blast. With the game's highest-known damage potential, this shotgun prioritizes damage over precision. This type of power comes at a cost. The Double-Barrel Shotgun only holds two shells at a time before requiring a slow reload, forcing players to make every shot count. Missing a zombie can leave players vulnerable and make them an easy snack. For seasoned players who have an accurate shot, this is a no-brainer. For newer players who need to take a step back from zombies, this gun might be better off left on the shelves.

2 Semi-Automatic Shotgun

Semi-Auto Doesn't Mean Semi-Useful

  • Firepower 683, Accuracy 25, Rate of Fire 30
  • Valued at $14,795
  • Found at specific locations on the map or military crates

Players who value hard hits and fast punches will get a kick out of the Semi-Auto Shotgun . This versatile weapon offers a good balance of damage, fire rate, and magazine capacity. It allows for quick follow-up shots and decent sustained damage, making it a great choice for various situations. Plus, it has good modding potential for further customization.

4:43
Related
19 Best Co-Op Zombie Games

The best co-op zombie games are the ones where players can enjoy hacking and slashing zombies together. Just make sure to be out of biting distance.

No need to push zombies out of the way, this shotgun's quick rate of fire makes it perfect for arms-length attacks, keeping the zombies at a healthy distance from players. Found in military crates and, more specifically, in a rectangular building east of the Dam, near a gas station hanging out of a car window, players find this shotgun to be a top contender . It's easily accessible, and there are five variants with high upgrade potential, solidifying its position as a top shotgun in the game. Players will find themselves tailoring this shotgun to their playstyle, whether it be raw, hard damage or quick, light-handed reloads.

1 Hellbeast

Bringing Hell To The Hordes

  • Firepower 1225, Accuracy 25, Rate of Fire 9000
  • Valued at $13,301
  • Craftable using 4 metal parts, 1 duct tape, 4 nails, 1 battery, 1 tin can, 1 electronic

Arguably the best gun in the series, the Hellbeast is a horde-hungry powerhouse that blasts out shots, taking down the toughest of enemies. This Anniversary Bundle shotgun reigns supreme with exceptional damage, a surprisingly fast firing speed, and a decent magazine capacity. This shotgun is limited to the DLC pack included in Dying Light: Definitive Edition , meaning all players who have this edition can use this blueprint. There is no base gun requirement, and players will find themselves crafting this powerhouse over and over again.

While it may not have as notably-high damage as the Double-Barrel Shotgun, its damage output, combined with its fire rate, makes it a terrifying force in the city against humans and zombies. Its rapid-fire capability makes it exceptional for close-quarters encounters with the dead where every second counts. Whether players are tackling the story alone or with a friend, the right shotgun paves the way for the hunt, the fight, and the shared victories that keep Dying Light alive.

item.title: 28 Best Defending Operators In Rainbow Six Siege
item.description:
Highlights

  • Consider the operator's abilities in different situations to choose the best defense operators in Rainbow Six Siege.
  • Thunderbird's healing Kona Station and Rook's armor-boosting RHINO plates make them solid support choices.
  • Pulse's HB-5 Cardiac Sensor and Smoke's Compound Z8 Remote Gas Grenades are great tools for denying enemy advances.

Rainbow Six Siege has been adding a ton of new operators continuously since the release of the game a few years ago, and that means there are a plethora of operators to choose from on both Attack and Defense. There are so many different things to think about when picking an operator in terms of who is best for which objective site, the map in question, what players are expecting their opponents to bring, etc.

To help narrow it down a little bit for players, here are the best operators on Defense in Rainbow Six Siege . The operators chosen aren't in any particular order, and have been included because of how often they're going to be a solid choice; not by how effective they can be in specific circumstances:

Related
8 Great Non-First Party First-Person Shooter Games That Deserve A Switch Port Feature

Some of these FPS games are classics that deserve to be experienced as a remaster on the Nintendo Switch.

Updated on May 27th, 2024, by Rhenn Taguiam: Year 9 of Rainbow Six Siege brings the first villain Operator in the tactical shooter's history in the form of Deimos, allowing teams to use his DeathMARK probe to reveal not just their enemies, but Deimos’ active location - as though forcing them into a no-holds-barred duel where one side is guaranteed to die. Being an Attacker, any team with Deimos who can track any Defender can give them an idea of their setups, making it much easier for their defenses to be breached. In turn, players need to stay on their toes and use more effective Defenders based on various situations. These include Operators who can freeze entire sections of the map, distract foes by smoking rooms, reinforce entryways with more durable materials, and even scan for active gadgets. All of these Defending Operators have been added to this list in its latest update.

28 Thunderbird

Long-Ranged Healing For Allies

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Normal, Normal

Operator Role

Support

Ability

KÓNA Station: Heals any Operator in its radius for 30 Health, revive any downed Operators

Primary

Spear .308 Assault Rifle or SPAS-15 Shotgun

Secondary

Bearing 9 Machine Pistol or Q-929 Handgun

Gadgets

Barbed Wire or Bulletproof Camera

Thunderbird relies on high-speed plays to secure positions and protect her allies. Her key ability lies in the Kona Station, as it can heal injured allies and even revive downed teammates. Thanks to the Kona Station , Thunderbird can rely on her mobility to transform zones into secondary defensive points for her allies. When utilized properly, Thunderbird can create vantage points for ambushes and successful roams.

Of course, being an electronic gadget, Kona Stations become clutter when disabled via EMP device. And as with any deployable, Kona Stations don’t last long against melee strikes, gunfire, and explosive damage. However, defensive gadgets such as MAG-NETs (Wamai), ADS (Jager), and Deployable Shields can help transform any room into a highly defensive bunker.

27 Rook

Boost The Team’s Overall Defense

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Heavy, Slow

Operator Role

Support

Ability

R1N “RHINO” Armor: 5 Armor Plates that add +15% Damage Reduction each when eqipped

Primary

MP5 Submachine Gun, P90 Submachine Gun, SG-CQB Shotgun

Secondary

P9 Handgun, LFP586 Handgun

Gadgets

Proximity Alarm, Impact Grenade, Observation Blocker

Unlike other Defenders, Rook specializes in providing support to the rest of the team. Being both a buffer and an anchor, Rook can boost his team’s defenses through his R1N “RHINO” Armor. At its core, Rook can deploy up to five RHINO plates that allies can pick up. When equipped, each plate can provide a significant boost to damage resistance. Given the buffing nature of RHINO plates, Rook synergizes well with Stim Pistols (Doc) and Kona Stations (Thunderbird).

Despite the 15% damage reduction from the armor plates, they do take around three seconds to equip. Moreover, unequipped armor plates become destructible from outside damage sources. When used properly, anyone with RHINO will only get downed instead of outright killed at zero HP.

26 Ela

Stop Targets From Moving In Rigged Spaces

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Light, Fast

Operator Role

Trapper, Crowd Control

Ability

GRZMOT Mine: A sticky proximity mine that releases a 6-meter concussive blast when triggered within a 4-meter radius

Primary

Scorpion EVO 3 A1 SMG, FO-12 Shotgun

Secondary

RG15 Handgun

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Deployable Shield, Observation Blocker

Yet another trap operator, Ela is a three-speed one-armor operator who has three Grzmot Mines that can be placed on any floor, wall, or ceiling. When an Attacker passes into the range of the mine, it detonates, concussing anybody in range.

The concussion effect makes it very difficult for Attackers to accurately see what's going on and impedes their movement ability. This acts as a way to make gunfights swing in the Defender's favor, or at the very least, gives some intel for the team. Ela has a very difficult-to-control primary weapon which is sometimes substituted for her shotgun, but she does have a pistol with a nice reflex sight.

25 Pulse

Scan For Attacker Heartbeats Through Walls

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Light, Fast

Operator Role

Intel, Support

Ability

HB-5 Cardiac Sensor: Scan lines highlight Attacker hearts pass through them even through walls with a detection range of up to 9m

Primary

M1014 Shotgun, UMP45 SMG

Secondary

M45 MESOC Handgun, 5.7 USG Handgun

Gadgets

Nitro Cell, Deployable Shield, Observation Blocker

For Pulse , intelligence is the best defense. Thanks to his HB-5 Cardiac Sensor , this roaming Defender can track opponents through surfaces - transforming his defensive specialty into an opponent’s worst nightmare. Players using Pulse can see opponents highlighted via the Heartbeat Sensor and even hear the beep go louder depending on their proximity. As such, players can use the HB-5 to note enemy positions and give valuable intel to create ambushes.

Of course, being an electronic gadget, Attackers can disable the HB-5 quite quickly. For instance, Shock Drones (Twitch), EMP Grenades (Thatcher), and locators (IQ) can dismantle both Pulse and the HB-5. Players need to be wary of how often they deploy the HB-5, as Pulse becomes useless as a roamer without it.

24 Doc

Heal Allies To Get Back In The Game

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Heavy, Slow

Operator Role

Support

Ability

MPD-0 Stim Pistol: Heals for 200 Health when hit

Primary

SG-CQB Shotgun, MP5 SMG, P90 SMG

Secondary

P9 Handgun, LFP586 Handgun, Bailiff 410

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Bulletproof Camera

Despite a life of affluence, Gustave Kateb used his medical talents for humanitarian work, having started as a volunteer doctor in Doctors Without Borders until he got invited to work with the French Defense Health Service. Such was his talent and expertise in ecotoxicology and toxicology that he also became a member of the GIGN, which would later earn the attention of Team Rainbow. After Nighthaven’s defection, Gustave was assigned the leader of the Wolf guard sub-unit in charge of humanitarian missions, particularly due to his keen sense of detail and care for others.

Related
6 Best Villains In FPS Games

The best FPS games usually have a memorable villain that players can't wait to shoot.

Such was his care for his team that it’s reflected in his status as an agent. Known as Doc , his gadget is the MPD-0 Stim Pistol capable of not just healing but also reviving allies from afar. Shooting his Stim Pistol can heal up to 40 Health and may even overheal any Operator. Likewise, his Stim Pistol is capable of enough to jolt a downed Operator back to health. Such is the Pistol’s revive potency that the revived Operator is back to 75 Health instead of 20 Health from the manual revive. Doc’s healing and revival specialization makes him an integral part of any Defending Team’s arsenal. However, players must compensate for their lack of hard defense and offense with skill and gunplay.

23 Melusi

Slows Down Attackers For Easy Pickings

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Normal, Normal

Operator Role

Intel, Crowd Control

Ability

Banshee Sonic Defence Device: Deployed on a surface and gives -25% to -50% Speed to Attackers entering a its 4-2m

Primary

MP5 SMG, Super 90 Shotgun

Secondary

RG15 Handgun

Gadgets

Impact Grenade, Bulletproof Camera

Already a nature lover at a young age, Thandiwe Ndlovu joined the South African Defense Force to hone her skillset further and get the expertise she needed to protect wildlife around her. And while she became a decorated member of the one Parachute Battalion, a grave injury forced her to retire from the military and begin a career as a veterinarian and teacher of wildlife protection at the Southern African Wildlife College. It was during her time as one of the leaders of the Inkaba Task Force Anti-Poaching Unit that Team Rainbow invited her to join their ranks, with her efficiency being her crucial asset.

Known as Operator Melusi , players of Rainbow Six Siege can use her specifically for her Banshee Sonic Defence gadget. This is a deployable item that can be put on floors and walls, which then buzzes softly when Attackers are in its radius and line of sight. Not only that, Attackers are slowed down when in the radius of the Banshee, giving Melusi and her team time to strike quickly . Players who prefer taking care of enemies themselves without depending on their gadgets too much can rely on her Banshee as an early warning system for a fun firefight ahead.

22 Kaid

Disable Electronics In Surfaces To Delay Assaults

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Heavy, Slow

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Anti-Gadget

Ability

Rtila Electroclaw: Electrifies a 1.4m surface that disables all metallic gadgets within its radius

Primary

AUG A3 SMG, TCSG12 Shotgun

Secondary

.44 Mag Semi-Auto Handguun, LFP586 Handgn

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Nitro Cell, Observation Blocker

What Kaid lacks in speed, he more than makes up for in terms of durability and efficiency. Equipped with a pair of Electroclaws , this heavily-armored Defender can electrify the team’s defensive gadgets to further boost their defensive potential. Upon deployment, each Electroclaw can electrify metallic gadgets within a 0.75-meter radius, making them quite efficient for defending specific points.

Given Kaid’s approach , he and Bandit can work together to fully electrify a room with metallic gadgets. This factor means they do share similar playstyles, as well as weaknesses. Being an electrified gadget, the Electroclaws become detectable via drones and vulnerable against EMP-based attacks. Likewise, Kaid needs excellent map knowledge to know precisely where to position the Electroclaws for maximum efficiency.

21 Frost

Fully Disable Targets When Trapped

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Medium, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Trapper

Ability

MK2 LHT Welcome Mat: Floor-placed mats that render Attackers in a Downed But Not Out State, can be triggered once per mat

Primary

Super 90 Shotgun, 9mm C1 SMG

Secondary

Mk1 9mm Handgun, ITA12S Shotgun

Gadgets

Bulletproof Camera, Deployable Shield

An operator that might be surprising to see on this list, according to the most recent win-delta released by Ubisoft, Frost is o ne of the most under-picked Defenders and has the highest win-delta of all of the Defenders in the game. Frost is a 2-2 Operator, and she has three Welcome Mats . These work essentially like bear traps, activating once stepped on, downing, and pinning Attackers in place.

These Welcome Mats are generally placed underneath windows or on the top of staircases; in the places where they're the most difficult to see. However, Frost has been in the game for quite a long time now, so getting more creative with one's Welcome Mat placement could net players a better success rate. Frost also has a decent primary gun that, though it doesn't have a great rate of fire, stays pretty stable.

20 Mira

Look Past Windows While Protected From Bullets

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Heavy, Slow

Operator Role

Intel, Support

Ability

Black Mirror : Bulletproof one-way window

Primary

Vector .45 ACP SMG, ITA12L Shotgun

Secondary

ITA12S Shotgun, USP40 Handgun

Gadgets

Proximity Alarm, Nitro Cell

Mira is, quite possibly, the operator that changed the game most when added. Mira is a three-Armor one-Speed operator, and her Black Mirrors allow for one-way windows through reinforced (or not reinforced) walls. This allows Defenders to stay informed as to what exactly is going on on the opposite side of the wall, letting them stay better prepared.

Many Miras set up their Black Mirrors on a reinforced wall but leave the wall next to it unreinforced, allowing them to line up a shot from safety and peek towards the unreinforced wall while firing, usually giving them an easy kill. While Mira is a three-armor Defender without an ACOG, she has a super-useful and unique gadget and a weapon with a high rate of fire that more than makes up for it.

19 Bandit

Punish Interactions With Metallic Gadgets

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Heavy, Slow

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Anti-Gadget

Ability

Crude Electrical Devices, Shock Wires: Can send an electric charge that charges metallic objects, damaging Attackers for 9 Damage per second

Primary

MP7 SMG, M870 Shotgun

Secondary

P12 Handgun

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Nitro Cell

Jager's partner-in-crime, Bandit is a great counter to the hard-breaching Attackers . He is another three-Speed one-Armor Defender, and his gadget are Shock Wires that electrifies reinforced walls, deployable shields, and barbed wire. The electric current prevents Attackers from using their own gadgets on those objects; like Thermite and Hibana, for example.

Related
7 Forgotten PS1 FPS Games No One Remembers

These FPS titles on the original PlayStation were overlooked by many, but they still had a hand in shaping the genre into what it is today.

While most Attacking teams bring a Thatcher when they know they're going to have to breach a reinforced wall, a well-timed Bandit Battery can be placed as soon as he hears Thermite lay down his Exothermic charge. This keeps the Bandit Battery out of most of the danger regarding Thatcher but still allows Bandit to perform his role. Bandit also comes equipped with C4, allowing him to make his own rotation routes in a pinch, though impact grenades or shotguns are generally preferred for the job.

18 Jager

Stop Projectiles From Activating

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Medium, Fast

Operator Role

Anti-Gadget, Support

Ability

ADS-MKIV Magpie: Can be placed on surfaces to intercept projectiles up to 5.5 meters

Primary

M870 Shotgun, 416-C Carbine Assault Rifle

Secondary

P12 Handgun

Gadgets

Bulletproof Camera, Observation Blocker

There are few objective sites in the game that don't benefit from a Jager's ADS-MKIV Magpie device. Jager is a three-Speed one-Armor operator, and his gadget destroys any incoming enemy ordnance like grenades, Ash's breaching charge, and more. When placed well, his ADS can be a very difficult gadget to destroy, and can severely limit Attackers' ability to use their own gadgets effectively.

Jager's three-Speed and set-and-forget gadget make him well-suited for roaming, and though he doesn't have the means to create his own rotation routes with an explosive or a shotgun, he makes up for that a bit by having a very good weapon - even without the ACOG.

17 Smoke

Punish Enemies With Deadly Smoke

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Normal, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Trapper

Ability

Compound Z8 Remote Gas Grenades: Releases toxic gas that has a 5-meter radius, lasts 10 seconds before disappearing, can deal 15 Damage every 1/33.3s

Primary

FMG-9 SMG, M590A1 Shotgun

Secondary

P226 Mk 25 Handgun, SMG-11 Machine Pistol

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Proximity Alarm

Rooms become death traps in the presence of Smoke , especially with his Compound Z8 Remote Gas Grenades that essentially render areas inhospitable throughout their duration. When thrown, these Grenades stick to surfaces and release smoke across a 5-meter radius and can take down Operators within three seconds of exposure. This time limit is especially dangerous, as the gas itself lasts for 10 seconds - more than enough for Smoke to appear and take out any enemies who try to escape it.

With this advantage, Smoke synergizes well with other “hidden” traps, such as Welcome Mats (Forst), Gu Mines (Lesion), and even Banshees (Melusi). However, as the Gas Grenades are remote-controlled, gadgets that disable electronics can interrupt Smoke’s gameplay style, making Shock Drones (Twitch) and an Electronics Scanner (IQ) deadly counters.

16 Aruni

Destroy Objects Or Damage Attackers Who Bypass Spaces

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Normal, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Anti-Gadget

Ability

Surya Laser Gate: Destroys any object or drone that passes through it, and deals 30 Damage to Attackers before being deactivated for 30s prior to reuse

Primary

P10 RONI SMG, Mk 14 EBR Marksman Rifle

Secondary

PRB92 Handgun

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Bulletproof Camera

When an unexploded land mine caused the death of the sister of Apha Tawanroong, she dedicated much of her life to ensuring unexploded ordinances won’t affect other people and their families anymore. Her studies helped her attain quite a knack for deduction, with her skills earning her a detective position in the prestigious Royal Thai Police. While she’s been able to use her ability to connect seemingly unrelated dots to solve cases, a grave injury left her without an arm and a leg. It’s thanks to Jaimini “Kali” Shah and her Nighthaven crew that Aruni got another shot at helping others. With their advanced prosthetics, Apha is once again able to go to the front lines. Using the codename Aruni , she became Nighthaven - and temporarily, Rainbow’s - resident heavy defender.

As a Defender in Rainbow Six Siege gameplay, Aruni is equipped with her Surya Laser Gate . Deploying this on walls will create a laser grid that covers its entranceway. While this lets Defenders pass, it damages Attackers and destroys all projectiles that pass through it. While most other projectiles can disable the actual Gate, this is still a waste of ordinance and can give Aruni and her team time for a counter-attack. And for players who like Operators with as many weapons as possible, Aruna's prosthetic doesn’t just give her a boosted melee attack but also punches through walls, hatches, barricades, and Armor Panels, and destroys most gadgets.

15 Thorn

Traditional But Efficient Punishment Trapper

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Normal, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Trapper

Ability

Razorbloom Shell: Detonates in a powerful explosion after a timer upon activation

Primary

UZK50GI SMG, M870 Shotgun

Secondary

1911 TACOPS Handgun, C75 Auto Machine Pistol

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Deployable Shield

Praised as one of tactical weapons expert of Garda Síochána’s Emergency Response Unit, Briana Skehan, or Thorn, became one of Team Rainbow’s more enthusiastic Defenders. Ever the energetic Operative, Thorn’s specialization as an Anti-Entry and Trapper Defender allows her to facilitate methods of counter-offensives against Attackers. Key to her arsenal is the Razorbloom Shell , a proximity grenade, which can be attached to surfaces, that explodes a few seconds after detecting an Attacker within its radius.

While Thorn’s Razorbloom Shell seems like a traditional trapping tool, it’s precisely this familiarity that allows her kit to be adaptable in most situations. Pairing Thorn with gadgets which can slow enemies down, like Gu Mines (Lesion), the Banshee Device (Melusi), or even the traditional Barbed Wire, can set up spaces to become death traps.

14 Goyo

Use Fire To Block Locations, Areas

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Medium, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Entry, Trapper

Ability

Volcan Canister: Deploy a canister on reachable surfaces and detonates on hit. Fire deals 12 Damage per tick, dealing 36 damage per second over 20s

Primary

Vector .45 ACP, TCSG12 Shotgun

Secondary

P229 Handgun

Gadgets

Proximity Alarm, Bulletproof Camera, Impact Grenade

When a bomb caused the loss of César Ruiz Hernández’s father and sister and gravely injured his mother, he was taught at a young age to be careful with his surroundings. After graduating from the Heroic Naval Military School, his tactical sense and forward-thinking in his days with the Fuerzas Especiales earned the attention of Team Rainbow. While his days of fighting antiquities trafficking with UNESCO and INTERPOL ended, his induction into Team Rainbow as Goyo introduced them to a rather deadly crowd control specialist.

Thanks to his Volcan Canister , Goyo is capable of unleashing carpets of flames in areas that practically deny players of Rainbow Six Siege entry into these zones. These canisters are deployable on all surfaces including furniture, transforming any room into a death trap under Goyo’s protection . Goyo can synergize Kapkan and Maestro for long-ranged activation, while his area denial potential is enhanced with other skirmishers such as Melusi, Aruni, and Wamai.

13 Wamai

Reroute Projectiles To Ruin Long-Distance Attacks

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Medium, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Gadget, Trapper

Ability

Mag-NET: Sticks to walls and surfaces to attract projectiles, reset the detonation timer, and exploding said projectile onto the device

Primary

AUG A2, MP5K

Secondary

Keratos .357, P12

Gadgets

Proximity Alarm, Impact Grenade

It’s thanks to his remarkable ability to stay longer underwater that earned Ngũgĩ Muchoki Furaha the admiration of his peers and aided in his careers in both the Kenyan Navy and the Kenya Special Boat Unit. Believing he’s “not from here,” Furaha spent much of his time from one dive site to the next to break his previous freediving records, with Nighthaven offering him a private boat and more downtime opportunities to enjoy this hobby. When Furaha temporarily transitioned into Team Rainbow, he went under the codename Wamai , a defender capable of rendering projectiles obsolete.

Thanks to his Mag-NET , he can deploy a unique gadget capable of stopping a projectile in mid-air and redirecting it toward itself. It then forcibly detonates the projectile, usually out of range from its intended target. A unique synergy here would involve Goyo’s Volcan Shield dormant in an area near the Mag-NET, with the enemy’s Frag Grenade being used to detonate Goyo’s deadly fire trap safely. Players who understand how deadly projectiles can be in Rainbow Six Siege gameplay know better than to underestimate the capacity of Wamai’s kit.

12 Maestro

Dual-Purpose Camera Turret For Adaptable Defense

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Heavy, Slow

Operator Role

Intel, Anti-Gadget

Ability

Compact Laser Emplacements, Evil Eyes: Emplaced gadget that acts as a camera that can see through smoke or as a turret that can deal 5 Damage per shot, at 20 Damage per second. It can fire 20 consecutive shots before overheating and having to cool down

Primary

ALDA 5.56 LMG, ACS12 Shotgun

Secondary

Bailiff 410 Handgun, Keratos .357 Handgun

Gadgets

Barbed Wire, Impact Grenade, Observation Blocker

Maestro is a very solid choice on most objective sites in the game. He's a three-armor one-speed operator, meaning he's much better suited towards playing an anchor as opposed to a roamer. His gadget further supports this playstyle. Maestro's Evil Eye cameras are entirely bulletproof (and melee-proof), and can only be destroyed by certain Attacker gadgets, like frag grenades or Sledge's Hammer, for example.

6:45
Related
15 Forgotten PlayStation 3 FPS Games That Almost No One Remembers

The PlayStation 3 had several great FPS games, along with a few titles that have been forgotten to time.

His camera has thermal vision which is incredibly useful when defending against a team planting the defuser inside of a smoke screen. His Evil Eye can also fire energy beams that don't do a lot of damage per beam, but the damage certainly stacks up over a few seconds. All of the above is not even mentioning that he has a fantastic primary weapon that can be attached with an ACOG. Maestro is a really strong Defender in the right hands.

11 Echo

Stun Enemies To Start Counter-Attacks

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Light, Fast

Operator Role

Intel, Crowd Control

Ability

Yokai Drone: Can be deployed on the ground to move and fit on drone holes, and on the ceiling is immovable and can fire ultrasonic bursts that disorient Operators within 15 meters

Primary

SuperNova Shotgun, MP5SD SMG

Secondary

P229 Handgun, Bearing 9 Machine Pistol

Gadgets

Impact Grenade, Deployable Shield

Quite possibly the most banned Defender on this list in the Ranked game mode, Echo is a three-Armor one-Speed Defender and is one of the most powerful operators in the game . Echo has two Yokai Drones that hover around the floor or on the ceiling, going nearly invisible when doing the latter.

These drones can spot enemies and fire ever-recharging concussion blasts that disorient Attackers for a short period of time. This concussion effect doesn't impede movement like Ela's Grzmot Mines, but it does prevent Attackers from planting the Defuser. This means an Echo in a safe location can easily prevent Attackers from accomplishing their objective if time is running short. Along with his stellar gadget, Echo has a fantastic primary weapon and also a secondary sub-machine gun.

10 Alibi

Lure Attackers With Projection Traps

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Light, Fast

Operator Role

Intel, Trapper

Ability

Prisma: Projects a volumetric display of Alibi, activating a 5-second tracking feature once an Attacker disturbs the projection

Primary

Mx4 Storm SMG, ACS12 Shotgun

Secondary

Keratos .357 Handgun, Bailiff 410 Handgun

Gadgets

Proximity Alarm, Observation Blocker

Undercover specialist Alibi relies on deception to protect locations in her Rainbow Six Siege gameplay, courtesy of her Prismas. When deployed, these devices project holographic displays of Alibi that are quite realistic, to the point that they ping the location of enemies who mistakenly shoot them.

Due to the deceptive nature of Prismas and the intense action of Rainbow Six Siege , it’s enemies will often shoot at an Alibi hologram - making her kit dangerous when securing an area. Unless enemies destroy a Prisma remotely, or shoot the actual device, Alibi can easily trick opponents into chokepoints. As her kit is similar to Valorant ’s Yoru , who can also release clones, Alibi players may even pretend to be a Prisma and shoot at enemies who are careless enough to pass her without pre-firing.

9 Mute

Disable Enemy Comms Prior To Retaking Sites

Health Rating, Speed Rating

Normal, Normal

Operator Role

Anti-Gadget, Crowd Control

Ability

GC90 “Moni” Signal Disruptor: Jams communication for remotely-activated gadgets within a 2.25-meter radius

Primary

MP5K SMG, M590A1 Shotgun

Secondary

P226 Mk 25 Handgun, SMG-11 Machine Pistol

Gadgets

Nitro Cell, Bulletproof Camera

Mute is one of (if not the absolute best) counter-intel operators out there. Mute is another 2-2 operator, coming equipped with four Signal Disruptors that disrupt enemy drones in the area, as well as other gadgets, like hard breacher's gadgets and Jackal's Visor.

They also stop Dokkaebi from having the chance to call the player's phone, provided they're in range or a Jammer. Well-placed Jammers can really stop the Attackers from gaining useful intel into certain rooms, making Mute a great pick for just about any objective in the game. On top of that, Mute has some serviceable weaponry, including a secondary sub-machine gun.

item.title: Nintendo World Championships: NES Edition - Launch Trailer
item.description: Complete over 150 challenges across 13 iconic Nintendo games, including The Legend of Zelda, Metroid, and Super Mario Bros 3.

item.title: Stardew Valley Creator Comments on How He Decides What Goes Into Updates
item.description:
Highlights

  • Developer Barone listens to fan feedback but ultimately trusts his own intuition when deciding on updates for Stardew Valley.
  • Fans may be surprised to learn that fan requests aren't the main factor in update decisions - Barone adds what he feels is missing.
  • Barone's track record of success with Stardew Valley shows that he knows how to keep fans engaged with the game's evolution.

In a recent interview, Stardew Valley developer Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone spoke about how he decides what makes it into the game's updates. The reveal is something fans of Stardew Valley who frequently make requests may want to keep in mind.

Stardew Valley is an extremely popular game due to the devotion of the game's developer. The initial base game was very well-received and quickly became an indie darling, but the long-term evolution of the game has propelled it to new heights. Everything from multiplayer to brand new locations have been added to Stardew Valley over time, and sometimes common fan requests make their way into new updates, too. However, that doesn't necessarily mean it's the leading factor for choosing update content.

Related
Stardew Valley Player Designs Neat Junimo-Themed Area on Their Farm

A creative Stardew Valley fan shares a look at their adorable farm layout, which features a unique area inspired by the Junimos.

In an interview with PC Gamer Magazine (via GamesRadar ), Barone discussed the game's updates and talked about what goes into them. When asked about fan requests making it into Stardew Valley , Barone said that he does pay attention to feedback and requests, but that it isn't the sole or leading factor he takes into consideration. Instead, he often adds ideas that he's thought of while playing Stardew Valley , when he finds himself wishing something was in the game. The majority of the updates are shaped by his whims and intuition.

This may surprise some fans, as many have drawn conclusions regarding similarities between what's added to the game and what fans request. The Iridium Scythe, for example, may have been suggested by Stardew Valley fans before being added to the official title. In another case, winter outfits were added in Stardew Valley 1.6 , and prior to that, a popular mod offered that option. Barone has even brought on the creator of the Stardew Valley Expanded mod to work in an official capacity, so he's clearly in touch with what's going on with fans and mods.

Eric Barone Knows What He's Doing

While Barone may not look to fan input first and foremost for the game, it should be clear that he knows how to make the game appealing. Stardew Valley began its rise to fame when it was solely his game, with no other developers working on it with him. While he's gradually brought on some extra team members to assist, the vast majority of what fans love about Stardew Valley is entirely of his creation. While it remains to be seen if any other major updates come to the game, the track record shows that any further changes will likely be welcome ones.
